Key Match Events: Pakistan won the match by 7 wickets (with 105 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan hasn't had a World Cup campaign worth talking about but because of who he is, and what he has done in his 17-year career, he is always in the spotlight.
Mohammad Rizwan's success with the bat aligns with his side's, but he has got himself in and, before any real damage can be done, got himself out.
Fakhar Zaman is fully fit, and given Imam-ul-Haq's struggles could find himself presented another opportunity.
Shadab Khan could not bowl against South Africa owing to concussion, and is not expected to be fit enough to play, giving Usama Mir another opportunity.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Since Bangladesh obtained Test status, they have qualified past the first round of the ODI World Cup as many times as Pakistan - twice in five attempts.
Until last week, Pakistan hadn't lost to South Africa in the ODI World Cup since 1999.
Three of Bangladesh's four all-time top ODI runscorers - Mushfiqur Rahim, Shakib al Hasan, and Mahmudullah - are part of the present squad.
